name: Adílson Ramos
comments: Singer and composer born in Rio de Janeiro

name: Leo Martin
comments: Serbian and former Yugoslav schlager singer

name: Asia Born
comments: Tsutomu "Tom" Shimura, better known by his stage name Lyrics Born (formerly Asia Born), is a Japanese-American rapper and producer.  He is one half of the duo Latyrx with Lateef the Truthspeaker.

name: Muhal Richard Abrams
comments: Bandleader, composer, and multi-instrumentalist associated with the free jazz movement.

name: Jane Bunnett
comments: Soprano saxophonist, flautist, and bandleader with primary interest in Afro-Cuban melodies.  Bunnett also composes.

name: Zager & Evans
comments: Rock-pop duo consisting of Dennis Zager and Rick Evans, active during the late 1960s and early 1970s

name: Lew Tabackin
aliases: Lew Tabackin and His Tokyo Friends

name: Jimmy Bowen
aliases: The Jimmy Bowen Orchestra and Chorus
Jimmy Bowen with The Rhythm Orchids
comments: 1950s pop vocalist, who later became a record producer and songwriter

name: G4
comments: Four-piece vocal troupe who first came to prominence when they finished second in Series 1 of "The X Factor". They are known for their operatic delivery of modern pop songs. In 2007 the band disbanded citing disagreements among the members but reunited in 2014 to celebrate their ten-year anniversary with a number of concerts nationwide, leading to a new album for Christmas 2015.

name: Ron Scuderi
comments: Rock 'n' Roll singer born in Brooklyn, New York. He will be known later as John K. Fox.

name: Kledir Ramil
comments: Brazilian popular music singer and composer

name: The Painted Ship
comments: Garage band from Vancouver, British Columbia.

name: Joe Venuti
aliases: Joe Venuti and His Blue Four
Joe Venuti and His Blue Six
Joe Venuti and His New Yorkers
Joe Venuti and The Venuti Trio
comments: Jazz violinist and composer. from South Philadelphia

name: Lucille Hegamin
aliases: Lucille Hegamin - Accompanied by Blue Flame Syncopators
Lucille Hegamin accompanied by Harris' Blues and Jazz Seven
Lucille Hegamin and Her Blue Flame Syncopators
comments: Blues singer and entertainer born in Macon, Georgia. Reported to be the second African American (after Mamie Smith) to record a blues song (1920).

name: Abbie Gardner
comments: Folk singer, dobro player and guitarist

name: Jaimee Paul
comments: Jazz and standards vocalist from Illinois

name: Alfredo García Segura
comments: Piano player, arranger and composer. Credited usualy with his brother as "Hermanos García Segura"

name: Augusto Algueró [Sr.] [Mapel]
comments: Composer and founder of the publishing company 'Canciones del Mundo'

name: Zakary Thaks
comments: Garage band from Corpus Christi, Texas.

name: Blake
comments: Harmony trio/quartet that performs classical and pop songs.

name: Pedro Biker
personal_name: Max Petersen de Andrade Corvo Barosso Judice
comments: Musician, singer, actor, radio and TV personality who was born in Portugal.

name: Montserrat Caballé
personal_name: Maria Montserrat Viviana Concepción Caballé i Folch

name: Nancy Martinez
comments: Vocalist known for singing various disco, dance, dance-pop and jazz styles including Hi-NRG and freestyle

name: Tihm
comments: Singer, active as a recording artist from 1968 till 1973.

name: Selah
comments: Contemporary Christian vocal trio originally consisting of siblings Todd and Nicol Smith and Allan Hall. In 2004 Nicol left the band and Amy Perry replaced her.

name: Billy Mann [US1]
comments: Singer, songwriter, record producer and music industry executive

name: Nick Lachey
comments: Pop and R&B music singer-songwriter, producer and TV personality

name: Pertti Reponen
comments: Lyricist, songwriter and musician, who started his musical career in the early 1960s in the Finnish folk movement. After the mid- 1960s he started writing song lyrics professionally and became one of most productive lyricists in the 1970s in Finland. In the 1980s and 1990s he also wrote scripts for TV shows.

name: Matti Siitonen
comments: Comic actor, musician, singer/songwriter and television presenter. He represented Finland twice in the Eurovision Song Contest.

name: Steve Klink
comments: American jazz pianist who principally works and performs in Europe.

name: Jennifer Scott [CA]
comments: Jazz singer and pianist born in Vancouver, British Columbia

name: Alessandro Marcello
comments: Nobleman who excelled in various areas, including poetry, philosophy, mathematics and, perhaps most notably, music, as a composer.

name: Sophie Makhno
comments: Lyricist and singer-songwriter of Ukrainian origin, who began her career as Barbara's manager from 1963 to 1966 and became artistic director of CBS in 1967

name: Carola [FI]
comments: Jazz and pop vocalist, who is considered to be one of the most important female vocalists coming from Finland. In the mid-1970s - tired of living constantly in the public eye - she retired from the music industry. She died of of Alzheimer's disease in 1997.

name: Yvhann Cévic
comments: Born in former Yugosalvia but emigrated when he was only a few months old.

name: Myriam Hernández
comments: Singer, songwriter and television presenter, known throughout Latin America for her romantic ballads.

name: Manuel Alejandro
aliases: Manuel Alejandro y su gran orquesta

name: Eugenia León
comments: Singer born in Tlalnepantla de Baz, Estado de México.

name: Dino Ramos
comments: Author, composer, singer and television animator.

name: Henry Stephen
comments: One of the earliest Venezuelan proponents of rock and roll music.

name: The Albion Country Band
comments: Originally formed in 1971 by Ashley Hutchings, formerly of Fairport Convention, to back his wife, Shirley Collins.  The band is still active, with the one constant member being Ashley Hutchings.

name: Henri Heymans
comments: Song translator, cover designer and record company executive

name: Luk Vandriessche
comments: Songwriter and presenter of the 1979 program "Klaproosters", on Radio 2 West-Vlaanderen

name: Erik Marijsse
comments: Journalist, singer, manager, presentator, born in Tielt

name: James Wilsey
comments: Bass player with the Avengers, but he became better known as the lead guitarist for Chris Isaak's band Silvertone (1985-1993).

name: Avengers
comments: Punk band from San Francisco, California. They reformed in 1999 featuring Houston and Ingraham.

name: Robert Miller [1]
comments: Electric bass player and composer.  Miller pursued a successful career as a bankruptcy attorney before returning to music in the early-1990s.  He is also the co-founder of the 32 Jazz label with Joel Dorn.

name: Adrienne Barbeau
comments: Best known as an actress, Barbeau is also a singer, playing the original Rizzo in the Broadway musical "Grease".  She achieved fame as Carol Traynor, Maude's divorced daughter, in the sitcom "Maude".

name: Chilliwack
comments: Vancouver-based rock band. Formed in 1963 as The Classics, became The Collectors in 1966, and finally Chilliwack in 1969. Disbanded in 1988. The band was reactivated in 1997 and still active.

name: Willem de Vries
comments: Known as Wim de Vries. Bass player, composer, vocalist, producer

name: Margaret Christl
comments: Singer of traditional Canadian and Scot songs as well as contemporary folk style songs. Immigrated to Canada from Scotland in 1966.

name: Tony Bird
comments: Bird was raised in colonial Nyasaland, now Malawi, and his music is influenced by UK and US folk, rock, country, and African music.

name: Renée Fleming
comments: Classically trained soprano who specializes in opera

name: Rumba Club
comments: Latin jazz band based in Baltimore.

name: Laird Jackson
comments: Jazz singer born in Cleveland, OH.

name: Sara Forestier
comments: Actress and filmmaker born in Denmark

name: Hector
comments: Singer-songwriter, who has also distinguished himself as a translator of song lyrics, but has written popular lyrics of his own too.

name: Axel Stordahl
aliases: Axel Stordahl and His Orchestra and Chorus
comments: Best known as an arranger, he also composed several songs.

name: Alan Broadbent
comments: Jazz pianist, arranger, and composer now based in Los Angeles, California

name: Eugén Tajmer
aliases: Eugén Tajmer med hans Eugenier og kor

name: Worm Quartet
comments: Not really a quartet. Comedy electro-punk project by Timothy Crist. Based in Syracuse, NY

name: Tír Na nÓg
comments: "Tír Na nÓg" is Irish for "Land of the Young" - Folk band formed in Dublin by Leo O'Kelly and Sonny Condell. They are often considered as one of the first progressive folk bands with other artists like Nick Drake or Pentangle.

name: Joe Haymes
aliases: Ted Wilson and His Orchestra [Joe Haymes]

name: Annette Hanshaw
aliases: Annette Hanshaw accomp. by Three Blue Streaks
Annette Hanshaw and Her Sizzlin' Syncopaters
Gay Ellis and Her Novelty Orchestra
Gay Ellis and Her Sizzlin' Syncopators
comments: Popular singer.  Hanshaw, who didn't particularly like show business, retired to become a housewife in 1934.

name: Paul Gonsalves
aliases: Paul Gonsalves and His All Stars
comments: Tenor saxophonist best known as a featured soloist in the Duke Ellington Orchestra .

name: Gyuri Spies
comments: Pianist, conductor, arranger, engineer and producer

name: Robert Jan Stips
comments: Pianist/keyboardist, singer, producer, arranger and songwriter born in The Hague. He was a founding member of Supersister in 1967. When that group disbanded in 1974, he joined Golden Earring for two years.

name: Anvil
comments: Heavy metal band from Toronto, Ontario, formed in 1978.

name: Messer Chups
comments: Surf rock duo from Hamburg formed in 1998.

name: Jeannie C. Riley
comments: Country pop singer; she became a Born Again Christian in the 1970s and moved into gospel music

name: Marco Antonio Muñiz
comments: Singer, known all over Latin America. Active since the second half of the 1940s.

name: Karen Mantler
comments: Jazz pianist, organist, chromatic harmonica player singer and composer. She's the daughter of experimental jazz icon Carla Bley and trumpeter/bandleader Michael Mantler (born August 10, 1943 in Vienna, Austria).

name: Godley & Creme
comments: Formed in 1977 by Lol Creme, and Kevin Godley

name: Wade Walton
comments: Blues guitarist, singer and harmonica player from Clarksdale, Mississippi

name: Eugene "Hideaway" Bridges
comments: Blues and soul singer, guitarist, bandleader, and songwriter based in Houston, Texas

name: The Rhythm Boys [US]
comments: Vocal trio, which teamed up with Paul Whiteman in 1927 performing with Whiteman's Orchestra as "Paul Whiteman's Rhythm Boys" before leaving Whiteman in early-1930. The trio disbanded in 1933.

name: Joe Temperley
comments: Scottish born baritone saxophonist who also plays, among others, bass clarinet and soprano saxophone.

name: Philip Kirkorov
comments: Bulgarian-born singer, who is a five-time winner of the "Best Selling Russian Artist" title at the World Music Awards ceremonies.

name: Lee Konitz
aliases: Lee Konitz & His West Coast Friends
comments: Jazz alto saxophonist and composer associated with the "cool jazz" movement

name: Horace Parlan
comments: Hard bop and post-bop jazz pianist, who lived in Copenhagen, Denmark since 1973

name: Carbon 12
comments: An industrial project created by Steve Tushar, an accomplished Los Angeles-based producer, remixer, and sound designer.

name: Audrey Nohra Stainton
comments: Lyricist, active in Italy, married to film producer Anis Nohra

name: Iris Williams
aliases: Iris Williams with The Neil Richardson Orchestra

name: The Number Twelve Looks Like You
George A. Norton
comments: Best known as a lyricist, Norton also composed music.

name: William Frawley
comments: Best known as an actor, appearing in over 100 fims and the television series "I Love Lucy" (in which he played Fred Mertz.)  Frawley's early career was in vaudeville as part of a musical act.

name: Noël Deschamps
aliases: Noël Deschamps - Orchestra diretta da Gerard Hugé
comments: Singer and lyricist, active as a recording artist in the second half of the 1960s.

name: La Plebe
comments: Punk/ska band with mariachi influences, from San Francisco

name: The Fucking Buckaroos
comments: Folk punk band from San Francisco, California

name: Massacre Time
comments: Hardcore music tribute to the Italian/ Spanish/American horror/giallo film & spaghetti western genres

name: The Sore Thumbs
comments: Street punk band from San Francisco/Oakland, CA

name: The Forgotten [US]
comments: Punk rock band from San Jose

name: Beggars Opera
comments: Progressive rock group from Glasgow. Originally breaking up in 1975, they have reconvened with fluid membership on several occasions.

name: Marilyn Moore
comments: Jazz singer who sounded like Billie Holiday.  She and Al Cohn are the parents of guitarist Joe Cohn.

name: Brass Monkey [GB2]
comments: Rock band that put out one album and a few singles.  Notable for being fronted by vocalist Ben Case (nee Peter Lee Stirling), who later went on to fame as the singer Daniel Boone.

name: Kenny Brown [US2]
aliases: Kenny Brown and The Arkansas Ramblers

name: Frank Proffitt
comments: Traditional singer and banjo player.  Throughout most his life, he made a living by farming.

name: Richard Dyer-Bennet
comments: Born in England to an American mother, Dyer-Bennet's family moved to Canada in 1919, and he and his mother came to the United States in 1925.  Traditional singer.

name: Julie Henigan
comments: Academic, poet and traditional singer in the Springfield, Missouri area.

name: Tony Rose [GB]
comments: Folksinger who sang both traditional and contemporary material

name: Eileen McGann
comments: Folk singer, songwriter and traditional Celtic musician from Scarborough, Ontario.

name: Dave Dexter, Jr.
comments: Music journalist, record company executive, producer, composer, and lyricist.

name: We the Kings
aliases: We the Kings feat. Anna Maria Island

name: Mike Jackson
comments: Jazz pianist and composer born in Louisville, Kentucky

name: Justin Vernon
comments: Singer, songwriter, producer and multi-instrumentalist born in Eau Claire, Wisconsin and known for his falsetto voice

name: Gnags
comments: Band from Aarhus formed by brothers Peter and Jens Nielsen

name: Michael Falch
comments: Rock singer, songwriter, guitarist and author.

name: Barbara Fairchild
comments: Influential country and gospel singer and songwriter

name: Rex Hobart
aliases: Rex Hobart and The Misery Boys
comments: Country music singer and songwriter based in Kansas City, Missouri

name: Walter Woolf King
comments: Singer, stage actor, and film actor.

name: Ahmed Abdul-Malik
comments: Bass and oud player of Sudanese descent.

name: Lance Hayward
comments: Blind from birth, this jazz pianist moved to New York City at the age of 50.

name: McGuffey Lane
comments: Country rock band from Columbus, Ohio. Named after a street in Athens, Georgia.

name: Don Cook
comments: Nashville-based country music songwriter and producer

name: Hans Behrendt
comments: Drummer and percussionist acknowledged for his advanced metronome-like style. Before joining Ideal, he mainly workied with jazz and avantgarde formations. From the mid-1990s on, Behrendt turned his back on the music industry.

name: Ideal
comments: One of the musically most advanced but also most successful bands of the 'Neue Deutsche Welle' era.

name: Terence Blanchard
comments: Trumpeter, bandleader and composer, including of film scores

name: Lilla Polyák
comments: Singer and actress born in Győr.

name: Marlin Greene
comments: Singer, songwriter, producer and session man

name: Larry Adler
comments: Principally known as a virtuoso harmonica player.  He recorded classical, popular and jazz music.  Adler also recorded as a jazz pianist early in his career, when he also recorded vocals.

name: Kikki Danielsson
comments: Singer (mainly country style), yodeler, accordion player, occasional lyricist and TV presenter having had several hits in the Swedish charts.

name: Boris Gardiner
aliases: Boris Gardiner - chorus by The Keys

name: Dana McVicker
comments: American country singer, born in Baltimore, Maryland.

name: Alan Trajan
comments: Scottish singer/songwriter who released a single album. He was born in Livingston, Scotland.

name: Henry Butler
comments: Born in New Orleans and blind since birth, Butler is a pianist who plays a variety of styles, including  jazz, Caribbean, classical, pop, blues, and R&B.  Butler also occasionally sings.

name: The Lilly Brothers
comments: Bluegrass duo, active from the 1950s until the late 1970s

name: Don Stover
aliases: Don Stover and The White Oak Mountain Boys

name: Janet Bean
aliases: Janet Bean and the Concertina Wire

name: John McCutcheon
comments: Folk singer and multi-instrumentalist, including dulcimer, autoharp, guitar, and banjo

name: Aled Jones
comments: Welsh singer and radio and television presenter. As a teenage chorister he reached fame during the mid 1980s. He has lately become well known for his television work with the BBC and ITV, as well as his radio work.

name: Archimède
comments: Rock group from Laval, led by brothers Nicolas and Frédéric Boisnard.

name: Michael Hirte
comments: Harmonica player born in Spremberg, GDR.

name: Kari Tapio
comments: Singer from Suonenjoki in central Finland, often singing in a schlager or country style.

name: Rocío Dúrcal
aliases: Rocío Dúrcal con orquesta y coros
personal_name: María de los Ángeles de las Heras Ortiz

name: Daniel Beretta
comments: Singer, songwriter, actor and voice actor

name: Janet Planet
comments: Jazz singer and music educator originally from Appleton, Wisconsin

name: Peter Horton
comments: Singer, composer, musician and writer born in Feldsberg (now Valtice, Czech Republic)

name: Kurt Feltz
comments: Highly prolific poet, librettis and lyricist

name: Daliah Lavi
comments: Singer based in Germany for most of her professional life. In the early 1970s, one of the best selling artists in the German speaking countries and also successful on an international scale. Some of her releases were issued simultanously in English, German and Hebrew.

name: Juan Gabriel
comments: Gabriel was Mexico’s leading singer-songwriter and top-selling artist, with sales of more than 100m albums. His ballads about love and heartbreak and bouncy mariachi tunes became hymns throughout Latin America and Spain, as well as with Spanish speakers in the United States.

name: Michelle McManus
comments: Singer from Glasgow who won the second season of Pop Idol

name: Blackwater Park
comments: Group from Berlin with a British singer.

name: Lesley Garrett
comments: Soprano singer born in Thorne, South Yorkshire

name: The Affair
comments: Pop band from Sydney, which released two singles.

name: The Sound Judgment
comments: Features lead singer Cody Marshall. Band from Philadelphia.

name: Hoola Bandoola Band
comments: Politically left wing oriented 'Progg Rock' band initiated by Mikael Wiehe and Björn Afzelius and one of the most influential 1970s groups. They also joined forces with equally important Nationalteatern for a while. Temporarily reuniting in 1996, they opened for Bob Dylan and went on tour playing for 200,000+ people with recordings resulting in the album För dom som kommer sen

name: Al Haig
comments: Jazz pianist best known as one of the pioneers of bop, although he played other music besides jazz.

name: Ted Curson
comments: Bop and avant-garde jazz trumpet player.

name: The Agenda!
comments: Garage rock band from Athens, Georgia formed by Justin Robinson (vocals), Ryan Lewis (guitar/vocals), Ian Cone (bass/vocals), Dan Gellar (keyboard/tambourine), and Mat Lewis (drums)

name: An Experiment on a Bird in the Air Pump
Lars Roos
comments: Pianist mainly performing popular classic pieces but also releasing instrumentals of pop songs and ballads.

name: Georgia Brown [GB]
comments: Singer and actress who also made her home in the United States through much of her adult life.  She is best known for her roles in musical theatre.

name: Martin Horsey
comments: English actor and director, who played the original Artful Dodger in the London stage production of Oliver!

name: Keith Hamshere
comments: English actor born in Ilford, Essex, who played the original Oliver Twist in the 1960 West End production of Oliver!

name: Loquat
comments: Pop band based in the San Francisco area.

name: Misha Segal
comments: Israeli music producer and film composer.

name: Carl Anderson
comments: Soul, pop, rock and fusion vocalist.  Anderson was also an actor.

name: Ferdinand Bakker
comments: Rock guitarist, composer, producer, owner of The Park Studio. Father of Hardstyle DJ & producer Diederik Bakker, and singer Evelyn Bakker

name: Job Tarenskeen
comments: Saxophonist and vocalist. He later switched to playing drums.

name: Erik de Zwaan
comments: Guitar player ( Herman Brood , Phoney & the Hardcore, ...)

name: The Meteors [NL]
comments: New wave band. In 2004 and 2005 there has been a reunion to promote the CD.

name: Dodo Marmarosa
comments: Bebop pianist, who acquired his nickname in childhood due to his large head and short body. A much sought after pianist in the 1940s, mental illness ended his career prematurely.

name: Carmen Rizzo
comments: Producer, musician and music engineer, based in Los Angeles, California

name: Roger Smith [US2]
comments: Jazz pianist, keyboardist and organ player.

name: Gemini Soul
comments: Fformed in the San Francisco bay area in 2005, and iknown for their eclectic blend of jazz-funk fusion with an electronic element known as “Cyber Jazz.”

name: Still Standing
comments: Melodic punk trio comprising twins Justin and Johnny Santoro and Alex Zarzycki

name: Jimmy Rosenberg
comments: Another protege gypsy guitarist and composer.  His first recording was released when Rosenberg was 12 years old.  Rosenberg has had drug problems, mental health problems and other personal problems, and he has been unheard since 2005.

name: Ola Kvernberg
comments: Jazz violinist active on the Scandinavian Jazz scene since 2000. Kvernberg was awarded with a Norwegian Grammy and the country's biggest prize, The Kongsberg DNB, in 2011. In 2013 the Amanda (Norwegian Oscars equivalent) for the "Chasing the Wind" score followed.

name: Morty Palitz
comments: Palitz spent his career in the music business, starting as a record salesman and serving in A & R, as a producer, composer, and performer.  He also successfully experimented with techniques to improve the quality of recorded sound.

name: Mario Kinel
comments: Croatian lyricist, composer, translator, journalist and producer. Born in Sušak he began working as producer for music shows on Radio Rijeka In 1951. He translated and adapted many "San Remo" hits into Croatian and wrote many lyrics for Ivo Robić and Ljiljana Petrović. He died in Zagreb.

name: Ivica Krajač
comments: Croatian lyricist, singer, composer and theatre director. He was a member of the Zagreb band "Kvartet 4M" founded in 1956. At that time he was widely known under the nickname "Mali" (the little one).

name: Anita Wardell
comments: Born in the UK, jazz vocalist Wardell moved with her family to Australia when she was 12 years old.  Wardell returned to the UK in 1989 and is now based in London.  She is considered to be an exceptional scat singer.

name: D-Me
comments: Dance act consisting of vocalist Dimitri Vantomme and producer Serge Ramaekers

name: Shark
comments: Musician, singer-songwriter, record producer, disc jockey and radio host

name: Isam B
comments: Vocalist, rapper and songwriter for the multi-award winning hip hop group Outlandish. His family hails from Nador in the north-eastern part of Morocco.

name: Loonis McGlohon
comments: He started his professional career prior to World War II, leading a trio in which he played piano.  He worked as a sidemen for many singers and for a time was essentially the house pianist for Audiophile .  He was also a prolific composer.

name: Wally Fowler
aliases: Wally Fowler and His Georgia Clodhoppers
comments: Country and gospel singer, songwriter, manager and promoter.

name: Keld & The Donkeys
aliases: Keld og The Donkeys med Lena og Johnna

name: Eric's Trip
comments: Indie rock group from Moncton, New Brunswick formed in 1990 that has disbanded and reunited several times.

name: Sébi Lee
comments: Classic rock 'n' roll singer, pianist, guitarist.

name: Guardianes del Amor
comments: Vocal pop quintet comprising Arturo Rodriguez, Oscar Saúl Cervantes, Daniel Poplawsky, Pablo Calderón and Ernesto Gracia

name: The Coolies
comments: Indie rock band from Atlanta, Georgia.

name: Squirrel Nut Zippers
comments: Band founded in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, playing a melange of styles, including swing, gypsy jazz and blues

name: Burning Heads
comments: Punk rock band founded in Orleans

name: Willie Brown
comments: Blues guitar player and vocalist and is considered as one of the pioneering musicians of the Delta blues genre.

name: Aleksandr Panaiotov
comments: A pop musician and songwriter born in Zaporozhye, Ukrainian SSR, USSR. He was the second best on ''The Voice'' of Russia season 5 in 2016. His real name is Aleksandr Sergeevich Panayotov (in Russia Александр Серге́евич Панайотов).

name: Chris Jones [US1]
comments: Blues, rock, folk and country music guitarist, singer and composer born in Reno, Nevada and resided in Germany

name: Steve Baker
comments: British harmonica player, based in Germany.

name: Prince Albert Hunt
comments: Country blues singer and fiddle player from Denton, Texas

name: Alistair Hulett
comments: Born in Glasgow, his family immigrated to New Zealand when he was in his early teens, where he ultimately played the local folk circuit before relocating to Australia where he formed the punk folk band, Roaring Jack.  Radicalized by the first Gulf War, Hulett became a committed socialist and his own songs reflected his politics.  He returned to Glasgow in the late-1990s.

name: Evergreen Blueshoes
comments: Short-lived late-1960s psychedelic folk band from Los Angeles

name: Otto Demler
comments: Vienna-born pianist, composer, lyricist and producer.

name: Aurelio Fierro
aliases: Aurelio Fierro ed i suoi solisti

name: Steve Crosby
comments: Record producer, songwriter and music manager

name: Saraband
comments: English folk group formed in 1967 and now disbanded except for the rare concert.

name: Col. Bruce Hampton
aliases: Col. Bruce Hampton & The Aquarium Rescue Unit
Fiji Mariners featuring Col. Bruce Hampton
comments: Singer, guitarist and songwriter from Atlanta, Georgia who passed away after collapsing on stage at a benefit concert honouring his 70th birthday.

name: Sauvo Puhtila
comments: One of the most important lyricists in Finland in the second half of the twentieth century

name: Mauno Kuusisto
comments: Vocalist, opera singer (tenor) as well as actor

name: John Jacob Niles
comments: Folk singer referred to as the "Dean of American Balladeers" and an important figure in the folk revival of the 1950s and 1960s.

name: The Tannahill Weavers
comments: Folk band from Paisley, Scotland, specializing in traditional Scottish music.

name: Bryan Bowers
comments: Folk singer and multi-instrumentalist most closely associated with the autoharp.

name: Brad Shapiro
comments: Producer, arranger, bass player and songwriter

name: Debbie Dovale
comments: Pop singer from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. By the time she graduated Clairton High School in 1968 she had been making records for over five years. In the 1970s and 1980s she continued to perform in the Pittsburgh area under her married name, Natalie Hathazy.

name: Teddy Reno
comments: Singer, film and stage actor, record producer and television and radio presenter. In 1948 Reno founded the CGD record label and from 1961 to 2013 he organized a successful nationwide talent search contest and show called 'Festival degli sconosciuti' (Festival of the Unknowns).

name: Sergio Bruni
comments: Neapolitan singer, guitarist, and songwriter known as "La voce di Napoli" (The Voice of Naples)

name: Giada
comments: Lyricist and journalist. Former presenter of Radio Tiber in the fascist period, broadcaster who abandons in time, in January 1948 for not being condemned like many colleagues who had participated in the activity of the radio controlled by the fascist regime, in which jazz was widely used but opposed.

name: Helena Paparizou
comments: Singer and songwriter, born and raised in Sweden, who won the Eurovision Song Contest in 2005

name: Lys Assia
comments: Singer and actress, who won the first Eurovision Song Contest in 1956 with the chanson "Refrain".

name: Margaret MacArthur
comments: Singer and player of the MacArthur Harp and lap dulcimer

name: Caio Bascerano
comments: Composer, pianist and conductor born in Alexandria, Egypt

name: Gorni Kramer
aliases: Gorni Kramer e la sua orchestra
Kramer e la sua orchestra tipica Argentina
Kramer et son orchestre typique argentin

name: Mario Del Monaco
comments: Operatic tenor, who appeared at London's Royal Opera House, Covent Garden for the first time in 1946. During the ensuing years he became famous not only in London but also across the world for his powerful voice and heroic acting style.

name: Emil Stern
aliases: Emil Stern et son grand orchestre à cordes
Emil Stern  et son piano magique
Emil Stern et son piano mécanique
Emil Stern et son piano relaxe

name: Marcello De Martino
aliases: Marcello De Martino e la sua orchestra
Orchestra del Festival di Sanremo diretta da Marcello De Martino
comments: Bandleader and composer mostly working at the Italian public radio and television Rai in the 1960s and 1970s.

name: Corrado Mantoni
comments: Television presenter, writer, lyricist, voice actor and announcer simply known professionally as Corrado.

name: George Freedman
comments: Singer and composer. Born in Berlin but moved to Brazil while still a child; son of a German father and Brazilian mother.

name: Rosemary [BR]
comments: Singer & actress from Rio de Janeiro

name: Sam Weedman
comments: Singer, songwriter, guitarist and record engineer.

name: Ron Haffkine
comments: Producer, music manager, A & R, songwriter and partner of music manager Bobby Heller.

name: Glenn Miller [US]
aliases: 418th AAFTC Band under the direction of Captain Glenn Miller
Glenn Miller Army Air Force Band

name: Sam Coslow
comments: Songwriter, singer, movie producer and financial analyst Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970

name: Arthur Johnston
comments: Composer of music for popular songs, inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970

name: Jerry Miller [US1]
comments: Guitarist, singer and songwriter born in Tacoma, Washington

name: Christoph Brüx
comments: Songwriter, musician, producer, sculptor, painter and arranger

name: Craig Smart
comments: Canadian-born producer and singer-songwriter now living in Hamburg

name: Johnny Bundrick
comments: Keyboard player also known as "Rabbit". Besides various band memberships, Bundrick has been very active as a session and live musician for a multitude of artists including The Who, Eric Burdon, Donovan, Jethro Tull and many more.

name: Dan Folger
comments: Nashville-based songwriter, keyboard player and performer.

name: Mickey Newbury
comments: Country and pop music songwriter and recording artist.  Newbury has been inducted into both the Songwriters Hall of Fame and the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame.

name: Jimmy Webb
comments: Popular music composer who (co-)wrote numerous top 10 hits performed by various artists. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1986 and received a Johnny Mercer Award in 2003.

name: Roger Greenaway
comments: Principally known as a songwriter and record producer, Greenaway also sings and plays guitar.  He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2009.

name: Joe Melson
comments: Rockabilly singer, mainly active in the first half of the 1960s, and songwriter, inducted into the 'Rockabilly Hall of Fame' in 2002 and into the 'Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame' in 2018. Teamed up with Roy Orbison, Melson wrote such hits as “Only the Lonely (Know the Way I Feel)”, “Crying”, and “Blue Bayou”.

name: Gordon Mills
comments: Singer, songwriter and successful artist manager, responsible for the careers of artists such as Tom Jones, Engelbert Humperdinck. and Gilbert O'Sullivan. Mills was born in India while his father was serving in the Army.

name: Georges Moustaki
comments: Singer and songwriter born in Alexandria, Egypt. Adopted "Georges" as first name in honour of his idol Georges Brassens .

name: John MacLeod
comments: Songwriter and producer based in the United Kingdom

name: DuBose Heyward
comments: Poet and novelist.  His novel, "Porgy", was adapted into "Porgy and Bess".

name: Alex Callier
comments: Musician (bassist), composer, engineer and record producer

name: Tomaso Albinoni
comments: Self-proclaimed "musico dilettante" (amateur musician) from Venice. Albinoni came from a wealthy family but decided not to follow his father's footsteps and opted for a career in music. He never joined the "Guild of Musicians" because he didn't like performing in public and preferred to focus on composition. Famous and acclaimed during his lifetime, he is now ironically best known for a piece that he probably didn't write, the so-called "Albinoni's Adagio".

name: Frank Peterson
comments: Keyboardist, producer, engineer, composer and lyricist from Hamburg

name: Will Jennings
comments: Popular songwriter.  Jennings has won a Grammy, two Academy Awards and two Golden Globes for his work and is an inductee of the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2006.

name: Noel Hogan
comments: Musician (guitar), songwriter and producer, born in Moyross, Limerick, Ireland

name: Fred Karlin
comments: Oscar- and Emmy-winning composer, who scored more than 130 motion pictures and movies for television

name: Joe Raposo [US1]
comments: Composer, songwriter, pianist, television writer and lyricist. Arguably best known for writing the lyrics to the Sesame Street: Theme song

name: Arthur Kent
comments: Pianist and songwriter, who composed songs that were recorded by Ella Fitzgerald, Nat King Cole, Eydie Gorme, Steve Lawrence, and others

name: Sylvia Dee
comments: Lyricist and novelist born in Little Rock, Arkansas

name: Roger Christian
comments: Los Angeles DJ, active in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s, and lyricist, who co-wrote several songs for "The Beach Boys" and "Jan & Dean".

name: Lee Pockriss
comments: Songwriter who wrote many well-known popular songs and several scores for films and Broadway shows mainly during the 1960s and 1970s

name: Robertino
comments: Singer and actor, who is best known as "Robertino - The Young Italian Singing Sensation" of the early 1960’s. As a child star he appeared in Italian, Danish and German films.

name: Joe Lovano
comments: Associated with post-bop jazz, Lovano is a mutli-instrumentalist best known for tenor saxophone.

name: Don Powell [IT]
comments: American-born  vocalist, pianist and actor from Los Angeles, CA, who arrived in Italy in the early 1960s as an Archie Savage ballet's conductor. At the end of the tour he settled in Rome and founded "The King's Men Orchestra" with whom he performed with great success at some of the most important Italian clubs, both as singer and pianist.

name: The Five Dallas Boys
comments: Harmony vocal group from Leicester described as "Britain's first boy band". Active from the 1950s.

name: Pino Calvi
aliases: Pino Calvi e la sua orchestra d'Archi

name: Kumisolo
comments: Indie-pop singer and songwriter, based in Paris, France.

name: Claus Ogerman
comments: Musical arranger, orchestrator, bandleader and composer

name: The Ministry of Sound
comments: A studio pseudonym for musicians working out of Southern Studios, Denmark Street, London between 1966 and1968. They released one single.

name: Skid Roper
comments: Singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist from near San Diego

name: The Living Daylights
comments: Band from Newcastle active in the late 1960s

name: Cymbals Eat Guitars
comments: Indie rock band from Staten Island

name: Drago Britvić
comments: Poet, songwriter and journalist born in Pitomača, presently in Croatia in the Virovitica–Podravina County.

name: Vice Vukov
comments: The Šibenik-born pop singer used to be one of the most popular singers in Yugoslavia during the 1960's. He appeared at the Eurovision Song Contest in 1963 and 1965. Because of his support to the "Croatian Spring" movement he was politically persecuted. In 1970 his songs and his performing were banned in the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Fearing arrest he decided not to return to Yugoslavia after his Australian tour in January 1972. He settled in Paris, France instead. This ban was in force until 1988. He returned to Yugoslavia in 1976, but was forbidden from public performing and traveling. Improved political situation allowed him an attempt with a self-released compilation cassette release in 1986. After the introduction of democracy to Croatia, Vice Vukov became a prominent supporter of the Social Democratic Party of Croatia. He held a seat in the Croatian Parliament from 2003. In November, 2005 Vice Vukov had an accident and head injury, and since that moment on he was in a persistent vegetative state until his death.

name: Mišo Kovač
comments: Croatian singer born  in Tribunj, Yugoslavia

name: Chorale de la chanterie de l'amitié
comments: Ladies choir from the 12th arrondissement of Paris

name: Patricia Morison
comments: Film and stage actress and singer.

name: Azra
comments: Rock band formed in 1977 in Zagreb, Croatia

name: Branimir Štulić
comments: Rock musician, singer/lead guitarist, poet, singer-songwriter born  in Skopje, North Macedonia. In the period 1958-1991 he was Zagreb-based and since 1991 he is living in The Netherlands.

name: Renée Lebas
comments: Chanson singer of Jewish origin. Before WW II performing in left-wing cafés and after WW II the first French artist to address the Shoah in her songs, she collaborated with quite some of France's formost songwriters and musicians. In 1963, Lebas, claiming she was too old to sing love songs, retired as a recording artist and concentrated on tutoring newcomers.

name: Gianni Leone
comments: Musician and singer born in Napoli

name: Narciso Yepes
comments: Classical guitarist, arranger and composer, born in Lorca, Spain. He is considered one of the finest virtuoso classical guitarists of the twentieth century.

name: Cat Mother & The All-Night Newsboys
aliases: Cat Mother & The All Night News Boys

name: Jessica Molaskey
comments: Actress in musical theater and singer

name: Charles Grean
comments: Producer, arranger, composer and music industry executive.

name: Herb Geller
aliases: Herb Geller Quartet, featuring Kenny Drew
comments: Los Angeles born jazz saxophonist, flautist, clarinetist, composer, arranger, and band/orchestra leader. In 1962, Geller relocated to Germany and mainly worked out of Berlin and Hamburg, where he also passed away.

name: Edward Lisbona
comments: Songwriter, pianist and bandleader from Manchester, who under the name of Eddie "Piano" Miller, was also a popular piano player and bandleader of the 1950s and 1960s.

name: Dolores Fuller
comments: Songwriter, responsible for writing the lyrics to a dozen Elvis Presley movie songs, record label owner and actress

name: Don Cherry [US2]
comments: Principally a cornetist. He was a member of Ornette Coleman's ground breaking Jazz Group in the late 1950s and also a pioneer in the fields of structured improvised music and combining jazz with what later became known as World music

name: Luis Mariano
comments: Tenor and actor of Spanish Basque origin, who became one of France's most popular singers in the second half of the 1940s and the 1950s.

name: Grim Reaper
comments: Heavy metal band; from 2006 to 2022 the band was resurrected as 'Steve Grimmett’s Grim Reaper'

name: Mystic Prophecy
comments: Power metal band from Memmingen, Bavaria

name: Distant Thunder
comments: Metal supergroup started by vocalist James Rivera. Together with guitarists Gregg Gill and Eric Halpern, bassist Mike LePond and drummer Rick Ward the group issued one sole album.

name: Caroll Vanwelden
comments: Jazz singer and pianist based in Ghent

name: Dirk van der Linden
comments: Jazz musician, composer and producer. Mainly a keyboarder, he also plays guitar and bass.

name: Les Barbecues
comments: Formed by students from Amiens and Rouen with the name "Dixie Darlings", they changes to "Les Barbecues" in 1966.

name: Danish Radio Big Band
comments: Large jazz ensemble from Copenhagen, originally called the New Radio Dance Orchestra

name: Monica Lewis
comments: Singer and actress, who was the voice of Chiquita Banana between 1953 and 1967

name: André Verchuren
aliases: André Verchuren son ensemble et ses chanteurs

name: Sandro Assorgia
comments: Guitar player from Dutch band Van Dik Hout

name: Ed Trickett
comments: Contemporary folksinger/folk song interpreter and, for his day job, professor of psychology at the University of Illinois at Chicago.

name: John Cohen
comments: Folk musician, photographer, film maker, and musicologist. Cohen has documented through recordings, photographs and film the music and images of old time Appalachian musicians.

name: Harold Mabern
comments: Hard bop and soul jazz pianist originally from Memphis

name: Kirk Lightsey
comments: Jazz pianist rooted in hard bop.

name: Brian Conley
comments: English television personality, comedian, actor and singer

name: Budd Johnson
aliases: Budd Johnson and The Four Brass Giants
comments: Principally a jazz and R&B tenor saxophonist, Johnson also played (and recorded) on alto, soprano, and baritone saxes.  Johnson was also a vocalist and bandleader.

name: Hilton Ruiz
comments: Puerto Rican jazz pianist, playing principally Latin jazz and bop

name: Tito Manlio
comments: Lyricist and songwriter, both in Italian and in the dialect of Naples, whose most famous work is the song "Anema e core".

name: Tito Schipa
comments: Legendary tenore di grazia, mainly active in Italy and in the United States.

name: Tony De Vita
aliases: Tony De Vita, piano et rythmes
comments: Versatile pianist, arranger and orchestra leader. He wrote more than 500 songs and became a popular television personality in the 1970's and 1980's.

name: Brendan Kelly
aliases: Brendan Kelly and The Wandering Birds

name: Vieno Kekkonen
comments: Pop singer and accordion player from Karttula.

name: Alesha Dixon
comments: Singer, dancer, rapper, model and television presenter

name: Doug Raney
comments: Jazz guitarist. He moved to Denmark in 1977.

name: Jack Fulton
comments: Singer, who performed with Paul Whiteman and His Orchestra from 1925 to 1933, radio host, composer, songwriter, author and musician from Pennsylvania.

name: Michael Rabinowitz
comments: Rabinowitz is one of the few jazz bassoonists.

name: Jens Rugsted
comments: Singer, guitarist, bassist, songwriter and producer.

name: Pharoah Sanders
comments: Jazz multi-instrumentalist, principally recording on saxophone, and composer. He has recorded in a variety of styles, but is probably best known for his association with free jazz.

name: Bobby Matos
aliases: Bobby Matos Afro Latin Jazz Ensemble

name: Don Jacoby
aliases: Don Jacoby and the College All-Stars
comments: Jazz trumpeter born in York, Pennsylvania

name: The Heartbeats Rhythm Quartet
comments: Alt-trad string band active in the late-1980s and early 1990s originally billed as The Heartbeats on their debut album. Fiddle – Tara Nevins Guitar – Beverly Smith Acoustic Bass – June Drucker Banjo – Rose Sinclair

name: Tøsedrengene
comments: Group notable for their mix of pop-rock and reggae with Danish-language lyrics, who achieved great success in Denmark, their six studio albums selling more than a million copies

name: Wayne Wilkins
comments: Pianist, record producer, songwriter and record label owner

name: Don Marino Barreto Junior
aliases: Don Marino Barreto Jr. e il suo complesso
Don Marino Barreto Jr. et son orchestre
comments: Singer-songwriter and double bass player. He had to move to Spain following a revolution in Cuba, later he joined the Foreign Legion and then moved to Italy in 1949, where he enjoyed huge success as a singer.

name: Lise Haavik
comments: Singer, who has been living in Denmark since 1982.

name: Karen Dalton
comments: Folk blues singer and banjo player of Cherokee ancestry originally from Oklahoma.

name: Boh Runga
comments: Singer and guitarist from Christchurch. Only known to have released one album and a few singles in her own rights. Also a jewelry designer.

name: Randy Stonehill
comments: Singer-songwriter who is considered a pioneer of Contemporary Christian Music.

name: Jason Harrod
comments: Folk singer-songwriter and guitarist. Harrod previously played with Brian Funck as Harrod & Funck.

name: Dolour
comments: Indie pop group from Seattle, WA.

name: Terry Scott Taylor
comments: Christian singer-songwriter, musician and producer from California

name: Brooks Williams
comments: Acoustic guitarist and singer/songwriter, originally from Statesboro, Georgia, now living in Cambridge

name: Lost Dogs
comments: Musical "supergroup" consisting of vocalists, songwriters and guitarists from multiple Christian alternative rock bands

name: The Mistletoe Disco Band
comments: Anonymous studio session project for the label

name: Johnny Hamp
comments: Leader of a jazz and dance band.

name: Larry Wynn
comments: Singer and lyricist, who became a salesman.

name: Marta Sánchez
comments: One of the most important female pop singers from her home-country

name: Frank Deruytter
comments: Professional saxophone player and studio musician

name: Luna Twist
comments: New wave band, originally active from 1981 to 1983, but reunited in 2008.

name: Antietam
comments: Indie band formed in 1984 originally from Louisville, Kentucky before moving to the New York City area.

name: Trash Can School
comments: Sextet with three guitars and a saxophone.  Described by various critics as "garage", "noise", "grunge", "goth", and "more jazz than rock".

name: Bob Regan [US]
comments: Country music songwriter, producer born in Sacramento, raised in South Lake Tahoe, California

name: The Moffatts
comments: Boyband comprising four brothers, Scott and triplets Bob, Clint & Dave

name: Ray Miller [US]
aliases: Ray Miller and His Black and White Melody Boys
Ray Miller and His Hotel Gibson Orchestra
Ray Miller Melody King and His Black and White Melody Boys
Ray Miller's Black and White Melody Boys
Ray Miller's Black & White Melody Men
comments: Dance bandleader from Pennsylvania active in the 1920s

name: Geoff Mann
comments: Singer, lyricist, artist and, ultimately, a clergyman in The Church of England.  After undergoing a religious experience when established in his career in music, his post-experience work largely focused on Christian themes.

name: Robert Wells [SE]
aliases: Robert Wells and His Rhapsody Lounge Orchestra
comments: Pianist, composer, occasional singer and band leader. Wells a. o. composed the TV theme for the 2008 Olympic games in Beijing and is the conceptionist behind the “Rhapsody In Rock” series of performances.

name: Speedy King and His Feetwarmers
comments: Rock 'n' roll band created by Guido Belcanto and his brother, finalists of "Humo's Rock Rally" in 1978

name: George Perris
comments: Athens-born crossover pop crooner, musician and songwriter. He is multilingual and sings in Greek, French, English and Spanish. Perris has released studio albums, live albums and live DVDs in various countries worldwide.

name: Jeff Leyton
comments: Stage actor and tenor famous for playing Jean Valjean in Les Miserables

name: Leonardo Schultz
comments: Music agent, singer and songwriter from Buenos Aires

name: The Choir [US1]
comments: Cleveland, Ohio garage rock band, active in the mid- to late-Sixties.

name: Brave New World [US1]
comments: Rhythm and blues band with psychedelic sound from Seattle, Washington

name: Rapeman
comments: Punk rock trio from Chicago, Illinois

name: Joe Chambers [US2]
comments: Songwriter, producer and founder of Musicians Hall of Fame in Nashville.

name: Aram Khachaturian
comments: Armenian composer, born in Tbilisi, Georgia.

name: Nick Wheeler
comments: Guitarist and songwriter from Stillwater, Oklahoma.

name: Tyson Ritter
comments: Singer, bass guitarist, and songwriter from Stillwater, Oklahoma

name: Daddy Cleanhead
aliases: Daddy Cleanhead and The Chuck Higgins Band

name: Syd Nathan
comments: American hillbilly, country & western and rhythm and blues record producer. He started King Records.

name: Frank Rover
comments: Musician (keyboards, mandolin, accordion), singer, lyricist and songwriter

name: Noble Sissle
aliases: Noble Sissle - Acc. by Sissle's Sizzling Syncopators
Noble Sissle and His Sizzling Syncopaters
Noble Sissle and His Sizzling Syncopators
Noble Sissle with His Special Orchestra
comments: Jazz composer, lyricist, singer, band-leader and playwright

name: Washboard Rhythm Kings
aliases: Washboard Rhythm Kings - Vocal Refrain by Eddie Miles
comments: Loose aggregation of jazz performers who recorded for several labels from 1931 through 1935.

name: Eva Taylor
aliases: Eva Taylor and Her Boy Friends

name: Lucas
comments: Pop-rock music singer-songwriter Season 2 quarter-finalist of the Danish edition of X Factor (5th place)

name: Sidsel
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 semi-finalist of the Danish edition of X Factor (4th place)

name: Alien Beat Club
comments: Pop and R&B music group Season 2 runner-up of the Danish edition of X Factor

name: Linda Andrews
comments: Pop and gospel singer, who won Danish "X Factor 2009"

name: Mohamed
comments: Dance-pop music singer Season 2 finalist of the Danish edition of X Factor (3rd place)

name: Seest
comments: Pop music singer-songwriter and producer Season 2 contestant of the Danish edition of X Factor (7th place)

name: Stanley Walden
comments: Brooklyn, New York-born composer, musical performer, and professor of musical theater. Perhaps best known for writing the music and lyrics of the revue Oh! Calcutta!

name: Caroline Costa
comments: Singer known from the TV-show "La France a un incroyable talent"

name: Rory Blackwell
comments: Drummer, singer, songwriter and early British rocker.

name: Ralph Burns
aliases: Ralph Burns and The Quiet Herd
comments: Bandleader, composer, arranger, and bop pianist.  He also worked with music in film, television and stage productions, winning two Academy Awards, two Emmys, and a Tony Award.

name: Joe Newman [US]
comments: Trumpet player and composer, probably best known for his stints with Count Basie & His Orchestra .
